alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Childress; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:19AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Childress, northwestern Motley, Hall and southeastern Briscoe Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Memphis to Valley Schools. Movement was east at 30 mph. The Memphis West Texas Mesonet site reported a gust to 55 mph at 2:10 am. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Memphis, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools, Northfield, Estelline, Lakeview and Plaska Community. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
